Replace.Text: Ye Yunzhou's younger sister, a sickly beauty who is pitiful to me. She was born weak and often had a fever and was bedridden. Fortunately, she was optimistic and didn't care. She loved to act like a spoiled child. Everyone in Dian Cang doted on her and she could call the wind and rain. [NewLine] Although she practiced Dian Cang's martial arts under the urging of her brother, due to her physical condition, she could not make any progress even if she remembered it thoroughly. She would pant even if she walked a little faster, let alone wield a sword. She didn't have any special hobbies, but was full of curiosity about the world under the mountain. [NewLine] She hated to suffer and take medicine. She would vomit if she was forced to eat, and she would sneer at people with a gloating face after vomiting.

For some reason, she and her brother came down the mountain, but were arrested by people from Dian Cang Mountain. There were many people in the world who coveted her, so she had to hide her whereabouts. She would rather wander around the world willfully than live a carefree life. The hardship of the journey made her fever and sick more frequently. Whenever she was conscious, she could fall asleep peacefully as long as she held her brother's clothes. "It's good to have my brother here. I don't want anything else. We can depend on each other like we are now, just like before..."

She has a great secret. The great-grandfather of the Ye brothers and sisters was one of the capable generals under Yue Yun, the son of Wu Mu, a famous general who fought against the Jin Dynasty. According to legend, Emperor Gaozong issued twelve gold medals in a row. Yue Fei was willing to die for his loyalty, but he lamented that the anti-Jin cause was not yet completed. If the military power was seized by treacherous people, the Song Dynasty would be powerless to turn the tide. Therefore, the main force of the Yue Family Army was dispersed and the treasure was hidden in the mountains. The cast iron military token was handed over to the eldest son Yue Yun for safekeeping, hoping that he could hold the military token to command the old subordinates in the future and inherit the ambition to protect the country. Unexpectedly, Yue Yun died before his father. In the crisis, he entrusted the military token to his subordinates and asked them to hide in the rivers and lakes and wait for Wu Mu's descendants to take it. The subordinate hid his name and lived in the mountains, calling himself a bandit, but in fact he had been guarding the military token for three generations. This secret was kept for nearly a hundred years, and finally it was known to people. The treasure and the military token brought disaster to the family.

On the day when her family was destroyed, the young Yunchang was slapped by a martial arts master invited by the court. Her meridians were broken, half of her body was paralyzed, and she was unlikely to survive. Fortunately, a master of the Dian Cang Sect went down the mountain to disperse the enemies in time, protected her heart with strong internal strength, and emptied all the elixirs in his pocket, which barely saved her life. After that, she and her brother became disciples of Dian Cang. She always knew that those who flattered her were nothing more than trying to get the secrets she hid. Even the master who saved her life was lured by her brother with treasures. I'm afraid no one in the family had good intentions except her brother. Even though she looked innocent, she was actually cautious all the time and grew up in hatred. Until you appeared. Although you are not good-looking, you disdain even treasures for your little sister, which makes her feel at ease.
Dian Cang's swordsmanship is the best in the world! Kill, kill, kill, kill!

Unlock Ironmaking, gain an extra swordsman when building a city, training, or purchasing a swordsman [NewLine] Swordsmen and Dian Cang disciples +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength +2 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement +1 Attacks, can still attack after moving, can still move after attacking [NewLine] Swordsmen and Dian Cang disciples recover all [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement and attacks after promotion

Swordsmen and Dian Cang disciples will initially receive 1 promotion, but will not be able to recover health naturally [NewLine] Swordsmen or Dian Cang disciples will be teased if they are at full health while stationed in a city, losing 20 health points, but gaining 50% of the experience points required for promotion. At the same time, the city will gain [ICON_PRODUCTION] production progress equivalent to twice the experience points gained

If the swordsman and Dian Cang disciples are stationed in the city with low health, they will recuperate according to the lost health. If the lost health exceeds 50/70/90, they will recover 20/40/100 health respectively, and provide [ICON_GOLD] gold coins and [ICON_FAITH] faith points equivalent to the restored health points, and restore [ICON_SCIENCE] technology points and [ICON_CULTURE] municipal progress equivalent to 1/2 of the health points.

Swordsmen and Dian Cang disciples initially receive 1 promotion, but cannot recover health naturally [NewLine] If a swordsman or Dian Cang disciple is stationed in a city with full health, he will be teased and lose 20 health points, but gain 50% of the experience points required for promotion. At the same time, the city will gain [ICON_PRODUCTION] production progress equivalent to twice the experience points gained [NewLine][NewLine] If a swordsman or Dian Cang disciple is stationed in a city with low health, he will recuperate and sort out the gains based on the lost health. If the lost health exceeds 50/70/90, 20/40/100 health points will be restored respectively, and [ICON_GOLD] gold coins and [ICON_FAITH] faith points equivalent to the restored health points will be provided, and [ICON_SCIENCE] technology points and [ICON_CULTURE] municipal progress equivalent to 1/2 of the health points will be restored.
Dian Cang Pearl & Experience the Chivalrous Spirit
Replaces the barracks, providing higher productivity, gold, and housing
Replaces the barracks, providing higher productivity

Swordsmen and Dian Cang disciples recover 50 health points when killing barbarians, and provide 1 habitability to all cities. For every 10 barbarians killed, an additional 1 habitability is obtained, with a maximum of 3 additional habitability.
Upgrading from a swordsman requires "Dian Cang Essence", +1 attack times, and a more powerful promotion
Dian Cang Sword Manual (Policy Card): +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength
Meteor Sword Manual (Policy Card): +10 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength
Break through the Cloud Pass: +5[ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength
Breaking through the Clouds Level 2: Gain +{Property}[ICON_STRENGTH] combat power from combo count
Sunlight: Gain +{Property}[ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength from killed units
+2 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Mobility, come and go freely, as if walking on flat ground
After killing a unit, permanently increase [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength and reset [ICON_MOVEMENT] movement to restore 50% of lost health
+10[ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength, allows melee units to ignore the city walls and attack the city directly

Dian Cang Quick Sword: +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength +2 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement +1 Attacks, can still attack after moving, can still move after attacking, restore all [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement and Attacks after promotion
Dian Cang Quick Sword: +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength
Dian Cang Pearl: Initially gains 1 promotion, but cannot naturally restore health

Breaking through the Cloud Pass: +5[ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength +1[ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement Strength. Combos will accumulate in battles. You will deal extra damage to the enemy based on the combo and remaining attacks. The combo will be reset after promotion.

Breaking through the Clouds Level 2: The extra damage caused by Breaking through the Clouds and Satap Meteor Sword will also be counted into the combo count, and you can gain extra [ICON_STRENGTH] combat power in the combo count. The combo count will no longer be reset due to promotion.
Satata Meteor Sword: +10 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength +2 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement Strength, the first attack after promotion deals triple damage
Great Hero: Restore 50 HP when killing a Barbarian, and give normal experience points
+5 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength +1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] mobility for all swordsmen and Dian Cang disciples
+10 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength +2 [ICON_MOVEMENT] mobility for all swordsmen and Dian Cang disciples
Meteor Sword Manual (Policy Card): +10 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength +2 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement Strength for all swordsmen and Dian Cang disciples
+25% combat experience +1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] movement for all swordsmen and Dian Cang disciples

Provides gold coins, general points and "Dian Cang Essence" (used for swordsmen to be promoted to Dian Cang disciples). After performing martial arts, policy cards, Dian Cang sword manuals and items, Dian Cang sword manuals are unlocked.

Provides "Dian Cang Essence", gold coins and general points. If it is run when equipped with the policy card · Dian Cang Sword Manual, it will provide the ability · Breaking through the Cloud Pass to all swordsmen and Dian Cang disciples after running 5 times.

Provides "Dian Cang Essence", gold coins and general points. If it is run when the policy card "Meteor Sword Manual" is equipped, it will provide the ability "Sa Ta Meteor Sword" to all swordsmen and Dian Cang disciples after running 10 times.

Provides "Dian Cang Essence", gold coins and general points. If it is run when the policy card · Yunshang Swordsmanship is equipped, it will immediately trigger the effect of the leader ability · Dian Cang Pearl for all swordsmen and Dian Cang disciples, and the obtained productivity will be provided to the capital; after running a certain number of times, it will provide all swordsmen and Dian Cang disciples with the ability · Breaking through the Cloud Pass lv2
Dian Cang Sect Tang Sect Branch
Dian Cang Sect Snow Mountain Branch
Dian Cang Sect Beggars' Sect Branch
The world is bitter, but I am sweet~
